test_types.name: Gram Stain
test_types.description: used to differentiate bacteria into two groups, Gram-positive and Gram-negative, based on their cell wall structure

test_types.name: Ziehl-Neelsen (ZN) stain
test_types.description: used to identify acid-fast bacteria, primarily mycobacteria, under a microscope

test_panels.description: To aid in the diagnosis of inflammatory, infectious and neoplastic diseases involving body fluids.

test_types.name: Free Thyroxine
test_types.description: To diagnose thyroid disorders

test_types.name: Total Thyroxine
test_types.description: General measure of thyroid output

test_types.name: Free Triiodothyronine
test_types.description: To diagnose thyroid disorders

test_types.name: Thyroid Stimulating Hormone
test_types.description: To screen for and diagnose hypothyroidism and hyperthyroidism

test_types.name: Total Triiodothyronine
test_types.description: Evaluates hyperthyroidism

test_panels.name: Cryptococcal Test Panel

test_types.name: India Ink
test_types.description: rapid diagnostic procedure used to detect the presence of encapsulated fungi, specifically Cryptococcus neoformans, in cerebrospinal fluid (CSF)

test_types.name: Cryptococcus Antigen
test_types.description:
To screen for and diagnose cryptococcal meningitis in people

with advanced HIV disease

test_panels.description: To screen for and diagnose cryptococcal meningitis in people with advanced HIV disease

test_types.name: Culture and Sensitivity
test_types.description: To identify the microorganism causing an infection and determine the most effective antibiotic for treatment.

test_types.name: Cholera Rapid Diagnostic Test
test_types.description: For initial detection or exclusion of a cholera outbreak (Not for use in case management)
test_types.hr_cadre_required: clinicians, nurses and any other trained staff

test_types.name: Prothrombin Time
test_types.description: To detect or diagnose bleeding or thrombotic disorders (PT)

test_types.name: Activated partial Thromboplastin Time
test_types.description: To detect or diagnose bleeding or thromboplastic disorders

test_types.name: International Normalized Ratio
test_types.description: To monitor performance of anticoagulant medications (INR)

test_types.name: Activated partial Thromboplastin Time Ratio
test_types.description: standardized way to express how prolonged the activated partial thromboplastin time (aPTT) is relative to a normal control

test_types.name: Fibronogen
test_types.description: A plasma protein produced by the liver that plays a key role in blood clotting (coagulation).

test_types.name: 50:50 Normal Plasma
test_types.description: a diagnostic test in hematology used to determine the cause of prolonged clotting times, such as a prolonged PT (Prothrombin Time) or aPTT (Activated Partial Thromboplastin Time)

test_types.name: 50:50 Mix FVIII Deficient
test_types.description: to investigate prolonged activated partial thromboplastin time (aPTT)

test_types.name: 50:50 Mix F-IX Deficient
test_types.description: specialized test used to evaluate whether a patient's prolonged activated partial thromboplastin time (aPTT) is due to a Factor IX deficiency (Hemophilia B) or other causes

test_types.name: Factor VIII Assay
test_types.description: measures the activity level of Factor VIII in a patients plasma

test_types.name: Factor IX Assay
test_types.description: measures the activity level of Factor IX in plasma

test_types.name: Thrombin Time
test_types.description: Time it takes for thrombin to convert fibrinogen to fibrin

test_panels.name: Coagulation Factor 50/50 Mixing Studies

test_types.name: 50:50 Normal Plasma
test_types.description: a diagnostic test in hematology used to determine the cause of prolonged clotting times, such as a prolonged PT (Prothrombin Time) or aPTT (Activated Partial Thromboplastin Time)

test_types.name: 50:50 Mix FVIII Deficient
test_types.description: to investigate prolonged activated partial thromboplastin time (aPTT)

test_types.name: 50:50 Mix F-IX Deficient
test_types.description: specialized test used to evaluate whether a patient's prolonged activated partial thromboplastin time (aPTT) is due to a Factor IX deficiency (Hemophilia B) or other causes

test_panels.description: To evaluate the mixing properties of an individual's blood components related to coagulation factors. Typically performed on patients with abnormal coagulation test results

test_types.name: Glucose
test_types.description: the main sugar found in your blood

test_types.name: Haemoglobin A1c
test_types.description: To diagnose and monitor diabetes mellitus
test_types.assay_format: High performance liquid chromatography/ colorimetric enzymatic method

test_types.name: Oral Glucose Tolerance Test (OGTT)
test_types.description: To diagnose diabetes and monitor treatment

test_types.name: 24hr Urine Protein
test_types.description: To diagnose diabetes and monitor treatment

test_types.name: Rheumatoid Factor
test_types.description: To aid in the diagnosis of rheumatoid arthritis and other autoimmune disorders

test_types.name: Antistreptolysin O Titre
test_types.description: serological marker indicating a recent or past infection with Group A Streptococcus

test_types.name: C-reactive protein
test_types.description:
To detect inflammation as an indicator of various conditions

  To monitor response to treatment

specimen_types.name: Venous Whole Blood
specimen_types.description: Deoxygenated blood which travels from the peripheral blood vessels, through the venous system into the right atrium of the heart.

specimen_types.name: Capillary Whole Blood
specimen_types.description: Usually obtained by fingerstick, heelstick (commonly used for infants), or from an earlobe

specimen_types.name: Oral Fluid
specimen_types.description: the liquid present in the oral cavity
